Title.evidence: This study evaluates the infarct growth rate (IGR) as a predictor of HT compared to baseline infarct volume.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were patients with anterior circulation LVOS, witnessed symptom onset, baseline MRI within 24 hours, and available day 1 imaging.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the infarct growth rate (IGR) as a predictor of HT compared to baseline infarct volume.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was any HT on day 1 imaging.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study included 775 patients (mean age 70.5 years).

Result_Outcome.evidence: A faster IGR was independently associated with a higher risk of HT (adjusted OR 1.35; 95% CI 1.16â€“1.57).
